careTargets.gradient: Strong thermal gradient with basking area at 95°F, warm side 85–90°F, cool side 75–80°F

notes: Very docile and handleable; enjoy interaction with keepers
Omnivorous: 60% vegetables, 40% insects for adults (young are 80% insects)
Slow-moving and curious; excellent beginner reptile
Males display impressive 'beard' when stressed or territorial
Require a very hot, bright basking area to thrive

warnings.message: Basking temperature must reach 95°F minimum - this is non-negotiable. Cold dragons develop metabolic bone disease (MBD). Use a thermostat on heating pad.
Impaction risk with sand/loose substrates. Use tile, newspaper, or paper towels instead. Avoid calcium sand completely.
UVB bulbs degrade every 6-12 months. Track replacement date and swap regularly to prevent MBD.
Bearded dragons are naturally docile and enjoy being handled 2-3 times per week. Avoid handling during shedding.
